result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kali Ann Troyer

records.addlTxt:
2:39 PM Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, RPR: Unmonitored DAR, Clk: Yates. Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court with Kali Ann Troyer.  Attorney Karl E Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Dolfi further reading waived; not guilty, no speedy trial demand. Court orders bond to continue in form and amount. Adjourned: 2:42 p.m.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Filed by DA Anderson. arc    e: Atty Dolfi.

2:30 PM Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, RPR: Unmonitored DAR, Clk: Yates. Attorney Karl E Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Kali Ann Troyer. Defendant Kali Ann Troyer not in court. State requests warrant; PD argues stay. Court orders warrant issued; body only, stayed until 1:05 p.m. 8/19/22. Recess at 2:32 p.m. DE appears late for hearing. Recalled 2:42 p.m. Defendant Kali Ann Troyer in court. Court quashes warrant. PD waives prelim. Officer dismissed. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Adjourned: 2:46 p.m.
Arraignment scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Fleet Farm in Hudson, WI. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping. 

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

1:24 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K. Anderson, Attorney Michael Joseph Becker and Intern Connor Smith in court for State of Wisconsin.Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Kali Ann Troyer. Defendant Kali Ann Troyer appeared by video, in custody. DE qualifies for public defender. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading. State requests bond, DE is currently on DJOC and intends to file motion to revoke. Atty. Harrelson makes bond argument. Court sets bond. Court sets PH. Adjourned: 1:28 PM. kma
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
